channel.title: MYB
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MYB, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AI's Manufacturing Renaissance: Why The Future Of Value Creation Will Return To Making Things
item.description: The great economic transformations that built modern prosperity weren't driven by services but by industrial revolutions.

item.title: Make America Tan Again: “Big, Beautiful Bill” Burns The Tanning Tax
item.description: Tucked among the trillions of dollars in tax cuts in the House’s just passed “big, beautiful bill” is repeal of a 10% tax on tanning services.

item.title: Ransomware Kill Chain Whacked As FBI, Secret Service, Europol Attack
item.description: Ransomware attacks just got harder to pull off.

item.title: Case Study: Defense-In-Depth Even More Important In A Quantum World
item.description: This strategy is important in quantum computing, when power and speed will have the ability to wreak havoc on data security.

item.title: Neil Druckmann Ends The Last Of Us ‘Cure’ Debate, Is Wrong
item.description: Neil Druckmann has addressed an infamous The Last of Us debate. He is also very wrong, despite what he's saying about the Firefly Cure.

item.title: 1,000 fans (which sort?)
item.description: Not all customers are fans. And not all fans are the sort of customers you can thrive with. Cadres of supporters often migrate into one of two camps… ...

item.title: Clarke’s Law (part 2)
item.description: All sufficiently advanced technology is now widespread. Batman used to have gadgets that gave him an advantage over his adversaries. And Henry Ford ha...

item.title: “How do I get the most of out my people?”
item.description: Alas, this is the wrong question for a leader or manager to ask. It’s more productive to wonder, “how do we create the conditions for our people to ge...

item.title: The most important decision
item.description: “What should I do next?” Not next year or for the rest of my life. Right now. The apparently trivial choice–whether or not to open an email, make a ph...

item.title: “They’re not paying me enough to care”
item.description: This is an understandable sentiment. As jobs push people to be automatons and often offer little in the way of respect, it’s easy to quietly quit. But...
